title: Teaching
text:
Teaching

Summer 2022: GOVT 2305 American National Government
Spring 2023: GOVT 2306 State and Local Government
Summer 2023: GOVT 2305 American National Government


1 + 1

[1] 2

title: Assignment 1
text:
Start drafting a research project framework:

Identify a topic of interest

I am interested in investigating questions of legitimacy and public opinion pertaining to the US Supreme Court.


Write up the research question

What components explain the variability in New York Times op-ed coverage of the United States Supreme Court over the past year?


Do you have a dependent variable?

I plan to utilize principal component analysis, so I do not have a dependent variable in the classic sense.

What is the hypothesis?

Legitimacy will be an important theme/component of op-ed coverage of the Supreme Court.

title: About
text:
About Katie Sanchez
I am a PhD student at the University of Texas at Dallas studying Political Science. My focus is American Political Institutions.

title: Blog
text:
Week 1
This week I watched the Quarto video from Professor Ã‡etinkaya-Rundel, which I found very informative. I also created my own GitHub repository and several pages. I am finding Quarto in R Studio extremely easy to use; however, I am having some issues with hosting on GitHub. I am hoping to get these resolved this week.
Additionally, I have made progress on my research project for this course. I have selected a research question: What components explain the variability in New York Times op-ed coverage of the United States Supreme Court over the past year? To answer this question I want to conduct a principal component analysis of op-ed coverage of the Court. I have created a developer account with the NYT and generated an API key. I have also started experimenting with performing searches using this key in R.
